com.mousebird.maply

Interface VectorStyleInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VectorStyleSimpleGenerator

    public interface VectorStyleInterface
    The Vector Style Interface returns Vector Style objects for a given list of attributes. It also can be used to control which layers are displayed, possibly circumventing a large amount of processing.
    This class is a generator for the styles, which do the actual work. We use UUIDs for the styles so that we can collect all the vectors together for a particular style and then call that style with a single list of data. This makes data display far more efficient.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Returns true if the given layer (by name) should be displayed at all.

      Return the styles that match to the given list of attributes.

    • Method Detail

      • stylesForFeature

        VectorStyle[] stylesForFeature(AttrDictionary attrs,
                               MaplyTileID tileID,
                               java.lang.String layerName,
                               MaplyBaseController controller)
        Return the styles that match to the given list of attributes. Each of these styles will be called to generate visible geometry. Order is not important.
        Parameters:
        attrs - The attribute dictionary from the vector feature.
        tileID - The tileID if we're building from a tile source. null if not.
        layerName - The layer name if the data is coming from vector tiles.
        controller - Maply base controller where the
        Returns:
        A list of vector styles that apply to the vector data with the given attributes.

      • layerShouldDisplay

        boolean layerShouldDisplay(java.lang.String layerName,
                           MaplyTileID tileID)
        Returns true if the given layer (by name) should be displayed at all. If you return false, then those vector objects will not be displayed and potentially not even parsed.
        Parameters:
        layerName - Name of the layer to be displayed (or not)
        tileID - If we're using a tile source, this is the tile ID. If not, it will be null.

      • styleForUUID

        VectorStyle styleForUUID(java.lang.String uuid,
                         MaplyBaseController controller)
        Returns a vector style corresponding to the given unique ID. Each vector style has to have a unique ID which we'll use for sorting things.
        Parameters:
        uuid - Unique ID
        controller - Base controller used for the geometry.
        Returns:
        Vector Style to be used in displaying geometry.
